post.desc:
What if despite having worked her way to the top and becoming a daitengu, Megumu deep down still really wants to do fieldwork like she used to?

Hell, it might be that she's actually the best there is when it comes to reporting â€“ maybe stellar photography work â€“ and that's how she landed herself on the daitengu position. However, the managerial role leaves her no room for to go on the ground, and she can only scratch her itch writing articles just from second-hand sources.

And [**this kind of article-writing**](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ã‚³ã‚¿ãƒ„è¨˜äº‹) seems to be an issue in Japan, but it seems over in the western side we don't have a problem with it? ðŸ¤” Though I have seen people complain about news articles citing literally a Reddit post and nothing else.
